description: Number of reversible strings with n beads of 4 colors.
comments: Also the number of 4-ary strings of length m = n+1 with number of 1's, 2's and 3's all even. Bijective proof anyone? - _Frank Ruskey_, Jul 14 2002
formula: "BIK" (reversible, indistinct, unlabeled) transform of 4, 0, 0, 0...a(n) = (4^m+3*2^m+(-2)^m)/8, where m = n+1. - _Frank Ruskey_, Jul 14 2002G.f.: 2*x*(2-3*x-8*x^2)/((2*x+1)*(2*x-1)*(4*x-1)) [From Maksym Voznyy (voznyy(AT)mail.ru), Jul 27 2009]
author: _Christian G. Bower_
extensions: G.f. proposed by Maksym Voznyy checked and corrected by R. J. Mathar, Sep 16 2009.
